header.p: I recently gained access to a number of diverse systems: OpenBSD on sparc64, a variety of Linux machines (Debian, Ubuntu), NetBSD, FreeBSD, OmniOS, and Solaris.
I took the opportunity to port the BSD.lv family of tools to all of these systems. This article describes the steps, tools, and methods I used along the way.

section.p: The tools in question are all in the C programming language, all use Makefiles (specifically, BSD make), and all have similar make rules. At the start of the project, dependency management—location of libraries and dependint tools—was the builder's job.

Ex ante, all BSD.lv tools already use oconfigure for portability between Linux, OpenBSD, and FreeBSD. This system is a fork of mandoc's configuration script as long-ago adapted to kcgi. From kcgi it leapt to other systems, and in doing so has gained a lot of feature testing.
